*All Civil Service staff receive a privilege holiday for the Queen’s Birthday allocated to either the Friday preceding or the Tuesday after the late May Bank Holiday (28th May 2018) (Spring Holiday).

Holidays that fall on Saturdays & Sundays have been excluded from this list.

Security regulations for visitors

No Weapons Policy

The British High Commission, New Delhi has a strict ‘No Weapons Policy’.

No weapons will be allowed onto the compound and there are no facilities to store such weapons. Any person attempting to bring a weapon onto the compound will be required to leave immediately.

Personal Items

The British High Commission does not have the facility to screen or hold large bags, rucksacks etc. Customers may bring in a bag no larger than a briefcase or ladies handbag, but should be aware that this will be subject to a search by a suitably qualified guard.

Photography & Filming

If you intend to film or photograph the British High Commission, please contact the main switchboard on +91 11 2419 2100 and ask to speak with the Press & Communications Group.

Parking

There are no public parking facilities at the British High Commission. Persons visiting the Visa or Consular offices are advised to seek alternative parking.

Disability access agreement

British Deputy High Commission (BDHC) Bengaluru is located on the first floor of a commercial building. A ramp is available from the street level to access the ground floor only. While the building has a lift, it cannot be used in emergencies. Instead, meetings attended by visitors not able to access the first floor using stairs will be held in the office of the British Council Library, which is located on the ground floor of the BDHC building.

details.access_and_opening_times:
Consular assistance

The British Deputy High Commission in Chandigarh is pleased to announce that, from Friday 17th August 2018, it will provide consular assistance and services to British Nationals in Chandigarh.

Consular section opening hours

Consular Counter: 10:00 am to 12.00 pm, Wednesdays and Fridays

Telephone Enquiries: 09:00 am to 17:00 pm, Monday to Friday

E Mail: consularenquiries.chandigarh@fco.gov.uk

Feedback: feedback.consular.services@fco.gov.uk

Office hours

Monday-Thursday: 0930-1730 hrs

Friday: 0930-1430 hrs

VFS in Delhi

To book an appointment for Consular Services at the Chandigarh Office, please see our notarial and documentary services guide for India.

details.access_and_opening_times:
The British Nationals Assistance Office in Goa does not have access for differently abled people as there are three steps to the building lobby. For those who are differently abled and need to see us, we can meet them at the Goa Marriott Resort and Spa (100 meters away from our office). The Marriott has full access for differently abled people. Please call ahead for an appointment.

Office hours

Mon-Thurs: 0800-1600 hrs

Friday: 0800-1300 hrs

Mon- Friday: 0930 - 1230 (Consular counter/visiting hours)

To book an appointment for Consular Service at the Goa Office, please see our notarial and documentary services guide for India.
